page.title: 15Domesday and Dovercourt
page.content: The origins of Dovercourt gave us a chance to look at some real{Local History,and at the same time to see an original{Domesday}entry. We found that our area is mentioned although Harwich is not;an interesting piece of local rivalry!It seems that the name is based upon the old Celtic word "doer" or "dwrr",which meant water. At the time of the Battle of Hastings the land was held by the brother of Harold Godwinson;one{Ulwin.}We didn't discover what became of Ulwin,but the land was given as one of many packages to{Aubrey de Vere}who was also the Earl of Oxford and one of the principal figures,in the settlement of East Anglia.In 1086,the land was valued at the exhorbitant sum of Â£12.00;a pity that the pound doesn't purchase quite as much today!
